review: This product is built like an Apple product - or better.  It's FAST compared to a typical network TV, in fact its so much faster and easier to use that we put the TV's into brain dead mode and use these on our smart TV's.  Wireless connection works great and the digital audio output drives the surround sound directly.  Nice.  The voice command is a nice gadget, but not that useful in general.  It works only with Amazon digital TV products, and we watch Netflix and Hulu Plus more often.There's one major improvement Amazon could make to this device and they'd control the world, but I'm not telling them here!

author: Joann N. Robinson

review: We ordered both of these devices and tried them both.  We LOVE the Fire TV device.  Better video quality, faster processing and menu selection and the remote is much more user friendly.  Yes the channel selection is much larger with the Roku but are confident that Amazon will add more channels as time passes.  At the end of the day, you pay for a service that allows the user to stream older release movies and TV shows...whether its Netflix or Hulu or Amazon Prime or one of the other channels available.  If you're already a PRIME  member its a no brainer.  We added Netflix basic service because you can get more TV series episodes without paying additional fees to view each episode via PRIME.If you're trying to decide between Roku 3 and Fire TV, our vote is for the Amazon Fire.
